title: Jeffrey's Grocery Typeface
content:
Hi, I am wondering if anyone can ID this typeface? It doesn't have to have the drop shadow, I basically just want to find this or a similar font. It looks like Gotham with tiny serifs.

Thanks!!!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018135434im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Jeffreys_4421.jpg)
author: storefront

comments.content:
An edited version of some variation of F.W.Goudy's [Copperplate Gothic.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018135434/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/copperplate-gothic/)  
Don

Tried to identify [one](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018135434/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Restaurant-branding/5745415) very close recently with no success. As suggested by Don, this is close to Copperplate but too many details remain off to me (serifs shape, none of the standard weights looks to match, overall design is far more balanced, stroke thickness more regular and consistent...). I can only confirm the feeling you have regarding Gotham. That really looks like it with some serifs added (which is a long process but not so hard).  
Alternatives: [Biondi](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018135434/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/biondi), [Garçon Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018135434/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thomasjockin/garcon-grotesque)
Thank you for your help! I think one of these will work.
